Kenyaâ€™s Economic Journey

From resilience to innovation â€” a story of growth.

Kenyaâ€™s GDP has risen from Sh7 trillion in 2015 to over Sh11 trillion in 2025, reflecting resilience amid droughts, elections, and global shocks. The pandemic dip in 2020 was followed by a strong rebound in 2021, setting the stage for steady growth in the years that followed.

Economists attribute this milestone to infrastructure investment, expansion of the digital economy, and strong performance in agriculture and services. Industrial parks and renewable energy projects have diversified the economy further.
